reviews.review_msg: Great prof. Challenging, interesting, smart. Allows for difference in opinions, well spoken... highly recommended.
Great professor. Extremely clear, allowing students to be given a variety of points of view on all topics. He is an outstanding professor, who goes out of his way to help you.
very good

Moens is an excellent teacher. He goes slow in lectures so you are not scrambling to write and repeats if necessary. He keeps the lectures extremely interesting and is one of the best pol teachers ive had.  I would suggest his calss to everyone!
Excellent speaker, very intelligent, chooses words carefully and is thoughtful, although certainly biased in favor of Bush. Great class altogether

Amazing. His lectures are informative, interesting , and well prepared.  His lectures have a right-leaning bias, and will offend those on the 'hard-left' who refuse to approach his class with an open mind. Amazingly skilled, knowledgable and tactical in debates. All combined, he's an amazing prof.
Defending George Bush?  Sorry, if I was interested in this stuff I would just watch fox news. Awfull.
Yay a Christian professor, with an open mind!
Excellent prof. Even though he has strong opinions he is open to all other opinions. Very relevant lectures. He is a nice guy!
finally, a rightwing prof!!!!!!!!  i hate him b/c he is an ass, but yay rightwing
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
There is nothing bad to say about this prof. He gives great information passionatly, his assignments are fair, and I would definetly take him again
I really interesting prof who gives fair exams. A great introduction to international politics, a bit repetitive for international studies students but a good overview anyway.
I really interesting prof who gives fair exams. A great introduction to international politics, a bit repetitive for international studies students but a good overview anyway.
I really interesting prof who gives fair exams. A great introduction to international politics, a bit repetitive for international studies students but a good overview anyway.

Great professor, very interested in International Politics. He has good lecture notes, and even though he might have an accent, he explains his thoughts in a clear manner. Very approachable. Highly recommended!

Dr. Ramjee Parajulee was an excellent professor that manages to promote critical thinking skills among his students. He will help any students that is in need of any help. However, the textbook Sens and Stoett's Global Politics: Origins, Currents ad Directions is too boring and long to read. Avoid it.
Really great prof! Clear and interesting lectures, and I loved the documentaries.
Great prof!

Lectures are virtually pointless. It's just the textbook material thrown back at us in an incomprehensible jumble. Her grading made little to no sense. Great class material, poor professor... which unfortunately ruins the whole thing.

Grading was easy and the course was interesting. Her lectures are useless though as you can't understand her. I didn't go all semester, but you don't really need to. Just make sure you do the readings.
Eline is such a nice person! she's really approachable and love her students. Even though i didn't learn much from her I still like her personality lol

She's my favorite! She is very approachable and positive. She isn't too tough on her students but because she is passionate about her stuff I find you need to be at the best of your game to get the B+ or A's on your writing.

short essays, lots of reading material, kind/funny prof, would take again. Just keep up with the readings and do not procrastinate your essays. if he smells it was written last minute, you will not do well.

I did not find Serdar helpful when I asked him questions regarding assignments. He was often vague about instructions. I found him to be an inconsistent marker, and that he looked for things in assignments that the questions did not ask for. In POL 241, if you study the Study Guide you will do fine. Don't bother with the textbook.
Excellent professor and very accommodating.

This class by far was the best class I have taken at SFU. Logan is straight forward and likes work to be straight to the point. Make sure you have good writing skills and you will ace everything. Textbook was used and lectures are important along with not skipping any discussions. Midterm & final and paper were all easy! Just make sure you study
Great Prof.
Great Prof. Wonderful course.

I've taken 3 classes with him (all lower div). Highly recommended if you love POL/ IS. Approachable, funny, and knowledgeable. Quite vague with assignments so make sure you clarify if you're unsure about any component! Read the textbook for an A.
Excellent and well worth the time spent
Excellent
Wonderful and cared for the interst of students
Excellent prof. Managed to make things great. Lectures well well-deliverd and received.
good professor overall if u want a good grade pick him if you wann actually learn something pick him if you want a drinking buddy pick him

I have taken many distance courses at SFU, and the material is good. However, he is by far the worst distance TA ever. He had had minimal discussions, he replies to email weeks late and returns grades weeks late. He never checks his computer. Take this course in class!!!!! The material is great, but this prof by distance will turn you off IP.
He just reads off his slides, but encourages discussion and seems to be interested in the subject.  Not the most interesting prof, but his exams are easy!
Best prof. Excellent teacher and went the extra mile to help his students
Took him long time ago. Excellent notes and very helpful.
Readings were easy. Easy marker. Lectures were informative
No Comments
Completely ruined what should have been an interesting class. Hard marker.
Uselss, useless, uesless, boring prof, will avoid at all costs
No Comments
lecture easy to follow if yr not lazy--midterm a bit hard
He's very boring to listen to, however I think he's pretty clear

if you plan on eventually getting a phd in polisci, this is your guy. if you're somewhat interested in the subject but just testing the waters, stay away from him. he's extremely interested in the subject and expects everyone else to share his same enthusiasm.
Muller wasn't that bad. He handed out exam questions before exams, and his lectures were interesting and relevant. The TAs were great!
Lecture and reading materials are not explained. This course should be done by distance ed. Muller does not teach

Professor Muller is a really interesting.  His witty quips about various topics terrorism and the bush administration are hilarious.  His lectures are also engaging because he uses documentaries and current examples about the topic. And when he laughs about his own jokes, it's so cute.
Fantastic prof. knows what he is talking about, and he is passionate about what he teaches. Can't wait to take upper division courses with him.
Fair marker
Dr Brown is a good prof, but her multiple choice exam qs are ultra specific.

Worst class I've taken at SFU. Despite doing well, the grade was hard earned. The course material is not hard but the test consisted of very specific multiple choice r, meaning you have to memorize facts from the textbook. Sherri was also rude, moody, and made the course material unnecessarily hard for a 2nd year intro class.

This Prof pretends to care about you and would offer to read your material but the grades do not correspond with what she has said. She also picks favourites in her class and can be on the 'beechy' side.

I'd reccomend taking this course with another professor as a previous commenter implied. Sherri is completely disorganized and her lectures are lengthy in content and hardly concise to what she tests you on. MT written was fair, but the MCQ for the MT and Final were utter nonsense.  It tested you on if you could regurgitate the txtbook.

One of my favourite professors. The class was very interesting and she is an exceptional speaker. I would take a class with her in the future. The final exam was very difficult, though. Her TA Adam was really cool, too.
